conclusion: Understanding behavior of light beams a and b through the glass brick.
Light beams a and b are incident perpendicularly onto the flat surface AB.
Angles of incidence for both beams are zero, so they will not be refracted upon entering the glass.
Beams will be refracted at the curved surface due to non-parallel normal.
Refractive index depends on wavelength; higher frequency light has a higher refractive index.
Beam b, with higher frequency, will be refracted more than beam a at the curved surface.
Diffraction is more pronounced for light with longer wavelengths.
Light a, with a lower frequency and longer wavelength, is more likely to exhibit diffraction.
Final answer: Light b is less likely to exhibit diffraction than light a.
